beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: Here's where Traka 360 breaks you. 224 mi. Zone by zone.
beats.visual: Full route map, then zoom into first zone
beats.editing_note: Start with full route visible, then rapid zoom in. Ominous music hit. Avatar suffering face.

beats.label: ZONE 1: Mile 84
beats.narration: Mile 84. Early Sectors. First 135km feels great. flowing terrain outside Girona. But burning matches here costs you later.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 1 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 2: Mile 140
beats.narration: Mile 140. Mid-Race Rough Sectors. Some sections questionably rough and better suited to a mountain bike. The terrain starts demanding attention.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 2 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 3: Mile 186
beats.narration: Mile 186. Garmin Hill. The steepest, slowest, most brutal climb of the day. Deep into the ride when legs are cooked. This is where races are decided.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 3 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 4: Mile 210
beats.narration: Mile 210. Final Flat Run. After Garmin Hill and one more climb, a long flat roll home. Fatigue and headwind can make riders crawl.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Rocky Mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 4 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).
